methodology.description: DEEP geopolitical analysis: Follow incentives, not headlines. Track money, power, sovereignty loss.
approach: CUI BONO - Who benefits? Who loses?
FOLLOW THE MONEY - Capital flows, debt traps, profit centers
POWER DYNAMICS - Hegemon shifts, bloc formation, influence consolidation
SOVEREIGNTY - What is permanent? What is surrendered?
ELITE ACCOUNTABILITY - Whose interests are being served?
NARRATIVE vs REALITY - What story vs. what is hidden?
CROSS-EVENT PATTERNS - What is the bigger picture?

trade_sovereignty.name: Trade & Sovereignty
trade_sovereignty.description: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?

articles.title: Mexico’s tariffs on India are a double whammy after US tariffs
articles.summary: The steep hikes by Mexico have devastated several Indian industries already reeling under crushing US tariffs.

themes.name: Trade & Sovereignty
themes.description: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Trade & Sovereignty
Context: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?
KEY PLAYERS: INDIA, MEXICO
ASYMMETRY DETECTED: One side bearing tariffs while other enjoys preferential access. This is unequal exchange.
follow_the_money: PRICE IMPACT: Who pays higher prices? Consumers? Producers? Which businesses benefit from tariffs?
articles.critical_insight: CRITICAL: India trading energy independence (Russian oil) for capital access (US markets). Short-term gain, long-term strategic vulnerability.

articles.title: US Government Removes Embargo on Arms Sales to Cambodia
articles.summary: The Department of Commerce's ruling is the latest sign of the positive momentum in relations between Phnom Penh and Washington.

themes.name: Trade & Sovereignty
themes.description: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?

themes.name: Military & Security
themes.description: What resources are being fought over? Who profits from conflict? Is this a proxy war for bigger powers?

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Trade & Sovereignty
Context: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?
MILITARY-INDUSTRIAL PROFIT: Weapons sales, alliances, and security arrangements benefit defense contractors and arms manufacturers.
counter_narratives: COUNTER: Benefits for whom? Costs pushed to whom? Who actually gains?
COUNTER: Who bears the costs? Consumers or workers? Who captures the profits? Corporations or people?

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Capital Flows & Debt Leverage
Context: Who controls the capital? What leverage is being built through debt? Can countries pay back? What happens if they can't?
KEY PLAYERS: UGANDA, EU
CONFLICT OF INTEREST: Family members in positions of power negotiating deals. Personal financial gain vs. national interest.
MILITARY-INDUSTRIAL PROFIT: Weapons sales, alliances, and security arrangements benefit defense contractors and arms manufacturers.
red_flags: FAMILY IN NEGOTIATIONS: Conflict of interest. Do they profit personally from the deal?
MILITARY-INDUSTRIAL COMPLEX: Follow who profits from weapons, armaments, and security spending.
counter_narratives: COUNTER: Is this genuine development or resource extraction disguised as aid? Who controls the assets?
COUNTER: What are their personal financial interests? Are they serving their country or themselves?
follow_the_money: DEBT TRAP POTENTIAL: Repayment terms? Interest rates? Conditions? What if country can't pay?
COLLATERAL: What assets are being leveraged? Can creditors seize strategic assets?

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Trade & Sovereignty
Context: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?
KEY PLAYERS: INDIA
CRITICAL TRADE-OFF: Country trading energy independence for financial capital. This creates long-term vulnerability.
counter_narratives: COUNTER: Security for whom? Against what real vs. imagined threats? Who profits from arms spending?
COUNTER: Who bears the costs? Consumers or workers? Who captures the profits? Corporations or people?
follow_the_money: CAPITAL INVOLVED: Source of capital? How much? On what terms? Who controls it?
PROFIT CENTER: Interest payments? Returns? Who are the beneficiaries? Corporations, banks, or governments?
PRICE IMPACT: Who pays higher prices? Consumers? Producers? Which businesses benefit from tariffs?
articles.critical_insight: CRITICAL: India trading energy independence (Russian oil) for capital access (US markets). Short-term gain, long-term strategic vulnerability.

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Capital Flows & Debt Leverage
Context: Who controls the capital? What leverage is being built through debt? Can countries pay back? What happens if they can't?
KEY PLAYERS: VENEZUELA
follow_the_money: CAPITAL INVOLVED: Source of capital? How much? On what terms? Who controls it?
PROFIT CENTER: Interest payments? Returns? Who are the beneficiaries? Corporations, banks, or governments?
power_shift: HEGEMONY SHIFT: Is global power balance changing? Which nation gaining influence?

articles.title: Japan’s Inbound Tourism Is Booming, But Japanese Are Less Interested in Going Abroad
articles.summary: Japan’s government is cutting passport fees in a bid to incentivize overseas travel, which has yet to recover from the pandemic.

articles.title: Watch: Trump calls for new nuclear treaty as New START expires
articles.summary: U.S. President Donald Trump has called for a new nuclear arms treaty after the New START agreement with Russia expired, sparking fears of a renewed global arms race.

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Trade & Sovereignty
Context: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?
KEY PLAYERS: RUSSIA
MILITARY-INDUSTRIAL PROFIT: Weapons sales, alliances, and security arrangements benefit defense contractors and arms manufacturers.
power_shift: BLOC REALIGNMENT: New alliance forming or existing one strengthening. Who is gaining leverage?

articles.title: Indonesia, Australia sign new security treaty to affirm deeper ties
articles.summary: Analysts said the treaty is becoming increasingly important to Australia in the face of growing tensions with China in the region

themes.name: Trade & Sovereignty
themes.description: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?

themes.name: Capital Flows & Debt Leverage
themes.description: Who controls the capital? What leverage is being built through debt? Can countries pay back? What happens if they can't?

themes.name: Sovereignty Loss
themes.description: What is permanent? What can't be reversed? Is short-term gain worth long-term loss of independence?

specific_analysis: PRIMARY THEME: Trade & Sovereignty
Context: Who surrenders economic power? Who profits from trade arrangements? What permanent constraints are being locked in?
KEY PLAYERS: CHINA, INDONESIA, AUSTRALIA
counter_narratives: COUNTER: Security for whom? Against what real vs. imagined threats? Who profits from arms spending?
COUNTER: Is this genuine development or resource extraction disguised as aid? Who controls the assets?
follow_the_money: DEBT TRAP POTENTIAL: Repayment terms? Interest rates? Conditions? What if country can't pay?
COLLATERAL: What assets are being leveraged? Can creditors seize strategic assets?
power_shift: BLOC REALIGNMENT: New alliance forming or existing one strengthening. Who is gaining leverage?
